docs.snippet: The New England Patriots are offering new jerseys to all fans who want to get rid of the ones they bought with Aaron Hernandez’s name....
docs.lead_paragraph: The New England Patriots are offering new jerseys to all fans who want to get rid of the ones they bought with Aaron Hernandez’s name.
docs.abstract: New England Patriots will offer replacement jerseys for fans who purchased ones with Aaron Hernandez's name after his arrest on murder charges.

docs.snippet: Some teams might have waited for the legal process to play out, but the Patriots immediately cut Aaron Hernandez after his arrest on murder charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: Some teams might have waited for the legal process to play out, but the Patriots immediately cut Aaron Hernandez after his arrest on murder charges.
docs.abstract: Greg Bishop On Pro Football column examines decision by New England Patriots to immediately cut tight end Aaron Hernandez after his arrest on murder charges; holds that some teams might have waited for the legal process to play out, but Patriots, perhaps more than any organization in professional sports, do not deal in distraction.

docs.snippet: Sepp Blatter, the president of FIFA, soccer’s governing body, has responded to protesters by pledging to give at least $100 million in profits back to Brazil....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sepp Blatter, the president of FIFA, soccer’s governing body, has responded to protesters by pledging to give at least $100 million in profits back to Brazil.

headline.main: FIFA President Pledges $100 Million to Brazil

docs.snippet: The National Football League is not participating in an effort with the Obama administration to help promote enrollment in health insurance plans under the new health care law....
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Football League is not participating in an effort with the Obama administration to help promote enrollment in health insurance plans under the new health care law.
docs.abstract: National Football League says it will not participate in effort with Obama administration to help promote enrollment in health insurance plans under new health care law.

headline.main: N.F.L. Won’t Promote Enrollment in Health Insurance Under New Law
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Staying Out of Health Effort

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.snippet: Aaron Hernandez and Odin Lloyd shared a passion for football and little else. But their lives did cross, and now Hernandez, an N.F.L. tight end, is in jail, charged with Lloyd’s murder....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aaron Hernandez and Odin Lloyd shared a passion for football and little else. But their lives did cross, and now Hernandez, an N.F.L. tight end, is in jail, charged with Lloyd’s murder.
docs.abstract: Interviews with associates of former New England Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez and semi-pro linebacker Odin Lloyd reveal complicated relationship between the two men; their acquaintance offered Lloyd a glimpse of a rarefied corner of professional sports, but was also filled with constant reminders of the vast gulf between the two athletes; Hernandez, who is in jail for the murder of Lloyd, has pleaded not guilty.

headline.main: N.F.L. Star and Murder Victim: Where Diverse Paths Crossed
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Star and Murder Victim: Where Diverse Paths Crossed

byline.contributor: Steve Eder contributed reporting from New York; Ben Shpigel from Boston; and Joe Drape from Bristol, Conn.

docs.snippet: Mr. Hudson, whose interception helped defeat the Baltimore Colts in the 1969 Super Bowl, requested that his brain and spine be given to researchers studying sports-related trauma....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Hudson, whose interception helped defeat the Baltimore Colts in the 1969 Super Bowl, requested that his brain and spine be given to researchers studying sports-related trauma.
docs.abstract: Jim Hudson, defensive back who helped propel New York Jets to upset Super Bowl victory in 1969, dies at age 70.

headline.main: Jim Hudson, Who Intercepted Pass to Help Jets Win Title, Dies at 70
headline.print_headline: Jim Hudson, 70; Intercepted Pass to Help Jets Win Title

docs.snippet: A series of bombs near a bakery, at a funeral, inside a senior police officer’s car and at a football stadium killed at least 22 people across Iraq on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A series of bombs near a bakery, at a funeral, inside a senior police officer’s car and at a football stadium killed at least 22 people across Iraq on Friday.
docs.abstract: Series of bombs near a bakery, at a funeral, inside a senior police officer’s car and at a football stadium kill at least 22 people across Iraq.

headline.main: Iraq: Blasts Kill at Least 22 as Militant Attacks Rise
headline.print_headline: Iraq: Blasts Kill at Least 22 as Militant Attacks Rise
